thread.title: HS football picks: Go with Tewksbury
thread.title_full: HS football picks: Go with Tewksbury | Boston Herald

author: Dan Ventura , Week 4 Picks
title: HS football picks: Go with Tewksbury
text:
If you’re going to make a losing pick, you might as well do it in style. For the first time this year, we took a triple hit in Friday Pickorama.
The trio of East Boston, BC High and Walpole all lost by double digits, proving how badly we underestimated the winners (Madison Park, Andover and Milton, respectively).
With the possibility of another rough week in Pickorama, we’re heading to the excuse board. Any game lost this weekend will be attributed to Hurricane Joaquin.
TEWKSBURY over Andover: Should be a crazy night with the portable lights in Tewksbury.
BC HIGH over Brockton: Basing this pick on the real possibility that Kerry Raymond doesn’t play.
Foxboro over CANTON: Feel good about the Warriors unless it goes to overtime, where the Bulldogs have been lethal.
Holliston over WESTWOOD: Going against the advice of a certain parent — even if he is from Wolverine Country.
Marshfield over BRIDGEWATER-RAYNHAM: Could be one of the better contests this weekend.
MELROSE over Watertown: Red Raiders prevail in this battle of unbeatens.
Lawrence Academy over GOVERNOR’S ACADEMY: Hope this isn’t my annual get burned for picking against Governors game.
Central Catholic over EVERETT: The Raiders have a history of excellence at Everett Memorial, even if it’s just a one-game history.
ST. JOHN’S PREP over Malden Catholic: Eagles have too much arsenal for the upstart Lancers.
(HOME TEAM IN CAPS)
Last week: 7-3 (.700)
Season to date : 23-7 (.767)
